parser¶

Contains functions, which parse an image into an input grid.

Author: Marek Dohnal

Date: 17/03/2023

parser._resize_img_(img, interpolation)¶

Resizes image if it’s longest side is longer than 1000 pixels

Parameters:

  • img – the image to be resized

  • interpolation – interpolation to be used while resizing

Returns:

resized image

parser.img_to_grid(img_path: str, threshold=170, interpolation=1)¶

Returns a numpy array of numbers representing a padded grid ready for recognition from an input image.

Parameters:

  • interpolation – interpolation to be used while resizing, default is cv2.INTER_LINEAR

  • threshold – threshold to be used by the cv2.threshold() function

  • img_path – path to an image containing a suitable grid

Returns:

padded grid ready for recognition

auto-vasarely
